page.title: 19STRONGSTRY -- REDEVELOPMENT
page.content: {Strongstry}is a small industrial hamlet on the banks of the{River {Irwell.}It was built in the middle years of the nineteenth century by the Porritt family,local millowners who lived at The Cliffe,Stubbins,as housing for the workers in their textile mills.After many years of neglect,during which the stone cottages gradually fell into disrepair,they have recently been acquired by a housing association for redevelopment. Back-to-back cottages have been remodelled to provide modern and spacious accommodation.The hamlet has been designated as a Conservation Area,and is situated in a fine landscaped setting. The Porritt family home has recently been converted into a rest-home for the elderly,while the rest of the estate is controlled by the National Trust.
